Unit 3.title: Laws of Motion
topics: Law of conservation of linear momentum and its applications
Vehicle on a level circular road

Unit 4.title: Work, Energy and Power
topics: Work done by a constant and variable force
Elastic and inelastic collisions in one and two dimensions

Unit 5.title: Rotational Motion
topics: Centre of mass of a two-particle system
Centre of mass of a rigid body
Values of moments of inertia for simple geometrical objects
Parallel and perpendicular axes theorems and their applications
Rigid body rotation and equations of rotational motion
Comparison of linear and rotational motions

Unit 6.title: Gravitation
topics: Acceleration due to gravity and its variation with altitude and depth
Time period and energy of satellite

Unit 7.title: Properties of Solids and Liquids
topics: Young's modulus, bulk modulus and modulus of rigidity
Pressure due to a fluid column
Effect of gravity on fluid pressure
Streamline and turbulent flow, critical velocity
Excess pressure across a curved surface
Application of surface tension: drops, bubbles and capillary rise
Specific heat capacity, calorimetry, change of state, latent heat
Heat transfer: conduction, convection and radiation

Unit 8.title: Thermodynamics
topics: Thermal equilibrium and the concept of temperature

Unit 9.title: Kinetic Theory of Gases
topics: Equation of state of a perfect gas
Work done on compressing a gas
Law of equipartition of energy and applications to specific heat capacities of gases

Unit 10.title: Oscillations and Waves
topics: Oscillations and periodic motion: time period, frequency, displacement as a function of time
Simple harmonic motion (S.H.M.) and its equation, phase
Oscillations of a spring: restoring force and force constant
Energy in S.H.M.: kinetic and potential energies
Simple pendulum: derivation of expression for its time period
Wave motion: longitudinal and transverse waves
Displacement relation for a progressive wave
Standing waves in strings and organ pipes

Unit_11.title: Electrostatics
topics: Electric charges: conservation of charge, Coulomb's law, superposition principle, continuous charge distribution
Electric field: due to a point charge, electric field lines, dipole, torque on a dipole in a uniform field
Electric flux, Gauss's law, applications to charged wire, infinite plane sheet, spherical shell
Electric potential: calculation for a point charge, dipole, system of charges, potential difference, equipotential surfaces
Conductors, insulators, dielectrics, polarization, capacitors, capacitance, energy stored in a capacitor

Unit_12.title: Current Electricity
topics: Electric current: drift velocity, mobility, Ohm's law, resistance, I-V characteristics, power, resistivity, conductivity
Series and parallel combinations of resistors, temperature dependence of resistance
Internal resistance, potential difference, EMF, combination of cells
Kirchhoff’s laws, Wheatstone bridge, Metre Bridge

Unit_13.title: Magnetic Effects of Current and Magnetism
topics: Biot-Savart law, application to circular loop, Ampere’s law applications
Force on moving charge in magnetic and electric fields, force on a current-carrying conductor
Current loop as a magnetic dipole, bar magnet as an equivalent solenoid, magnetic field lines
Torque on a magnetic dipole, para-, dia-, and ferromagnetic substances, temperature effect on magnetism

Unit_14.title: Electromagnetic Induction and Alternating Currents
topics: Faraday's law, induced EMF, Lenz’s law, eddy currents, self and mutual inductance
Alternating currents, peak and RMS values, reactance, impedance, resonance, AC generator, transformer

Unit_15.title: Electromagnetic Waves
topics: Displacement current, electromagnetic waves, transverse nature
Electromagnetic spectrum: radio waves, microwaves, infrared, visible, ultraviolet, X-rays, gamma rays, applications

Unit_16.title: Optics
topics: Reflection, spherical mirrors, mirror formula, refraction at plane and spherical surfaces
Thin lens formula, lens maker formula, total internal reflection, magnification, power of a lens, refraction through a prism
Wave optics: Huygens’ principle, Young’s double-slit experiment, diffraction, polarization

Unit_17.title: Dual Nature of Matter and Radiation
topics: Photoelectric effect, Einstein’s equation, wave nature of particles, de Broglie relation

Unit_18.title: Atoms and Nuclei
topics: Rutherford’s model, Bohr model, hydrogen spectrum, nuclear composition, mass-energy relation, nuclear fission, fusion

Unit_19.title: Electronic Devices
topics: Semiconductors, diode characteristics, rectifier, LED, photodiode, solar cell, Zener diode, logic gates

Unit_20.title: Experimental Skills
topics: Vernier calipers, screw gauge, simple pendulum, Young’s modulus, surface tension, viscosity
Speed of sound, specific heat capacity, resistance measurement, focal length of mirrors and lenses, refractive index
Diode and Zener diode characteristics, identification of electronic components
